meanings.definition: To make lateral or to move to one side.
meanings.sent1: She lateralizes the books on the shelf for better organization.
meanings.sent2: The dancer lateralizes her movements to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent3: The cat lateralizes its toys around the room, creating a playful mess.
meanings.sent4: The river lateralizes its flow around the bend, carving a new path.
meanings.sent5: The sun lateralizes its rays through the window, casting long shadows.

meanings.definition: To divide or to arrange laterally.
meanings.sent1: He lateralizes the papers into two neat piles on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The chef lateralizes the ingredients on the cutting board before cooking.
meanings.sent3: The students lateralize the classroom into two teams for a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The artist lateralizes the colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful contrast.
meanings.sent5: The gardener lateralizes the plants in the garden, creating a symmetrical design.
